Rejoice in the LORD, O ye righteous: <FI>for<Fi> praise is comely for the upright.
Praise the LORD with harp: sing unto him with the psaltery <FI>and<Fi> an instrument of ten strings.
Sing unto him a new song; play skilfully with a loud noise.
For the word of the LORD <FI>is<Fi> right; and all his works <FI>are done<Fi> in truth.
He loveth righteousness and judgment: the earth is full of the goodness of the LORD.<RF>goodness: or, mercy<Rf>
By the word of the LORD were the heavens made; and all the host of them by the breath of his mouth.
He gathereth the waters of the sea together as an heap: he layeth up the depth in storehouses.
Let all the earth fear the LORD: let all the inhabitants of the world stand in awe of him.
For he spake, and it was <FI>done<Fi>; he commanded, and it stood fast.
The LORD bringeth the counsel of the heathen to nought: he maketh the devices of the people of none effect.<RF>bringeth: Heb. maketh frustrate<Rf>
The counsel of the LORD standeth for ever, the thoughts of his heart to all generations.<RF>to allâ€¦: Heb. to generation and generation<Rf><CM>
Blessed <FI>is<Fi> the nation whose God <FI>is<Fi> the LORD; <FI>and<Fi> the people <FI>whom<Fi> he hath chosen for his own inheritance.
The LORD looketh from heaven; he beholdeth all the sons of men.
From the place of his habitation he looketh upon all the inhabitants of the earth.
He fashioneth their hearts alike; he considereth all their works.
There is no king saved by the multitude of an host: a mighty man is not delivered by much strength.
An horse <FI>is<Fi> a vain thing for safety: neither shall he deliver <FI>any<Fi> by his great strength.
Behold, the eye of the LORD <FI>is<Fi> upon them that fear him, upon them that hope in his mercy;
To deliver their soul from death, and to keep them alive in famine.
Our soul waiteth for the LORD: he <FI>is<Fi> our help and our shield.
For our heart shall rejoice in him, because we have trusted in his holy name.
Let thy mercy, O LORD, be upon us, according as we hope in thee.<CM>
